metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Information can be passed to methods as a parameter. Parameters act as variables inside the method.
content.html: Information can be passed to methods as a parameter. Parameters act as variables inside the method.

content.text: Parameters are specified after the method name, inside the parentheses. You can add as many parameters as you want, just separate them with a comma.
content.html: Parameters are specified after the method name, inside the parentheses. You can add as many parameters as you want, just separate them with a comma.

content.text: The following example has a method that takes a String called fname as parameter. When the method is called, we pass along a first name, which is used inside the method to print the full name:
content.html: The following example has a method that takes a String called fname as parameter. When the method is called, we pass along a first name, which is used inside the method to print the full name:

content.code_html:
public class Main {
  static void myMethod(String fname) {
    System.out.println(fname + " Refsnes");
  }

  public static void main(String[] args) {
    myMethod("Liam");
    myMethod("Jenny");
    myMethod("Anja");
  }
}
// Liam Refsnes
// Jenny Refsnes
// Anja Refsnes

content.text: When a parameter is passed to the method, it is called an argument . So, from the example above: fname is a parameter , while Liam , Jenny and Anja are arguments .
content.html: When a parameter is passed to the method, it is called an argument. So, from the example above: fname is a parameter, while Liam, Jenny and Anja are arguments.

content.text: You can have as many parameters as you like:
content.html: You can have as many parameters as you like:

content.code_html:
public class Main {
  static void myMethod(String fname, int age) {
    System.out.println(fname + " is " + age);
  }

  public static void main(String[] args) {
    myMethod("Liam", 5);
    myMethod("Jenny", 8);
    myMethod("Anja", 31);
  }
}

// Liam is 5
// Jenny is 8
// Anja is 31

content.text: Note that when you are working with multiple parameters, the method call must have the same number of arguments as there are parameters, and the arguments must be passed in the same order.
content.html: Note that when you are working with multiple parameters, the method call must have the same number of arguments as there are parameters, and the arguments must be passed in the same order.

content.text: It is common to use if...else statements inside methods:
content.html: It is common to use if...else statements inside methods:

content.code_html:
public class Main {

  // Create a checkAge() method with an integer variable called age
  static void checkAge(int age) {

    // If age is less than 18, print "access denied"
    if (age < 18) {
      System.out.println("Access denied - You are not old enough!");

    // If age is greater than, or equal to, 18, print "access granted"
    } else {
      System.out.println("Access granted - You are old enough!");
    }

  }

  public static void main(String[] args) {
    checkAge(20); // Call the checkAge method and pass along an age of 20
  }
}

// Outputs "Access granted - You are old enough!"

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
In simple words: Inside a method, what does a parameter act as?
content.html: In simple words: Inside a method, what does a parameter act as?
